definition: Primary Key of the Entity dataset
title of the dataset. It is usually obtained from the title attribute of the original data source.
example_value: Overwintering strategies and life-history traits of different populations of Aphidius platensis along a latitudinal gradient in Chile

definition: dataset DOI, provided in URL
reference id to sharetrait dataset
indicate whether the reference corresponds to a primary or secondary reference
type of dataset
the name of repository where the dataset is published
licence of the dataset
version of the dataset that is published
complete citation of the dataset
example_value: Alfaro-Tapia, A., Alvarez-Baca, J. K., Tougeron, K., Lavandero, B., Le Lann, C., & Van Baaren, J. (2022). Overwintering strategies and life-history traits of different populations of Aphidius platensis along a latitudinal gradient in Chile (1.0) [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7774767

definition: ISO date of the publication
year of publication
contribution date for uploading the dataset in sharetrait
reference trait term used for the dataset, at the moment this is 1:1
free text remarks regarding the dataset, relevant to population and location (comments_reference),OPTIONAL
example_value: five Chilean populations of the aphid parasitoid Aphidius platensis.

definition: relevant notes about the reference, mostly specifying if the dataset has been published or not
Primary Key of the Entity manuscript
title of the manuscript
example_value: Overwintering strategies and life-history traits of different populations of Aphidius platensis along a latitudinal gradient in Chile

definition: manuscript DOI, provided in URL
type of manuscript, can be a journal article, published data method, software paper.
publisher of the manuscript
full citation of manuscript used for download. For now the type of citation is not provided.
example_value: Hermaniuk, Adam et al. “Low Temperature and Polyploidy Result in Larger Cell and Body Size in an Ectothermic Vertebrate.” Physiological and biochemical zoology : PBZ vol. 89,2 (2016): 118-29. doi:10.1086/684974

definition: ISO date of published manuscript
year of published manuscript
free text remark for the manuscript
example_value: study belonging to a range of species

definition: reference to dataset entity
reference to manuscript entity
reference to dataset entity
reference to population entity
date when a population is described
standard ISO date
standard ISO year
defines if population reference provides measurements that are derived from a collection rather than individuals
reference to dataset naming or identifiers used for the collection/population
defines if population reference provides measurements that are derived from a collection rather than individuals
free text based characteristics worth to mention about the specific population
example_value: A very big population, only decided to take a few representative

definition: species name given based on the study
comment containing year and name noted to the species
any relevant information specific for population if mentioned by author/article
any relevant remarks regarding the species described
reference to individual entity
reference to population entity
Primary Key of Individual Entity
an individual id for identifying subgroups
the current life stage if identified when an individual is being observed. Specify if it is a egg, larvae, adult stage when individual is collected
sex type of individual as indicated in the study when the individual is being observed
indicates if it is part of offspring generation or parent type. Used to controll the parenthood relationships
specification if the specimen has a related specimen in the collection, such as parent is known. If parent is unknown, then leave blank,
ID of a parent as specified in the reference study or dataset
Current size of the parent individual when collected
Standard unit of measurement for the size metric of the parent individual collected
Type of size metric of the parent
age of the parent
units used to define the age of the parent
indicates whether mating was allowed or not during the acclimation period
indicates the method used to estimate the fecundity
indicates the category for each developmental stage
type of size metric of the offspring
unit of size metric of the offspring
size value of the offspring
indicates whether eggs are protected or not after laying
example_value: protected (carried by the female, or attached to a substrate or floating in clumped masses)

definition: free description and remarks relevant to the individual as provided in the dataset
any extra comments that are not mentioned in the study
Primary Key of the relation Measurement
reference key to the Individual table
reference key to the Trait table
generic measure check type for trait name to make reference to sharetrait dataset trait name. For now the possible types are {development, fecundity, metabolic_rate},
measured value of the sharetrait trait
unit of measurement used for the trait
error associated with trait estimate
type of metric used to estimate error of the trait
trait measurement value that is converted for standardisation and data integration purposes
indicates the category for each developmental stage. specific for development
fresh body mass of individual
standard unit used for the fresh body mass of the individual
number of individuals tested for trait estimate
specification for the measurement size of the individual when the trait measurement is taken
size value at the start of the development stage of the individual. Specific for the developmental trait measurement
size value at the final of the development stage of the individual. Specific for developmental trait,
size value of the individual
unit of size metric
type of size metric
life stage used during the experiment as defined by the researcher in the paper
specific life stage used during the experiment as defined by the researcher in the paper
specific initial life stage used at the start of the trial as defined by the researcher in the paper.
specific life stage used at the end of the trial as defined by the researcher in the paper
comment and relevant notes regarding the trait measurement as defined by the researcher,
standard date when the measurement is being calculated.
indicates the temporal scale does the fecundity unit encompass,
indicates the reproductive stage of individuals as defined by the researcher in the paper,
indicates where the experiment to determine the fecundity was carried out
relevant notes about the experimental conditions,
example_value: Larvae exposed to dinitrophenol conditions and low food level. Larvae from the low food level received the same amount of Artemia three times a week, and in the fil instar additiolly were fed one chironomid three times a week

definition: primary key of the sharetrait trait
defined trait for the trait entity
trait db identifier given to the trait
reference trait term used for sharetrait dataset
this will include what category the trait refers to. At the moment we have only functional, but it can be morphological, behavioural..
functional expression used for defining the trait, used for reducing ambiguous interpretation of sharetrait definition of the trait measurement,
example_value: Frequently measured as rate of oxygen uptake or rate of CO2 production.

definition: parent id of trait, especially for subcategory traits defined
life stage term used for a state of phase that can be specific for trait
end stage term if defined for a phase
full trait definition to explain the term of the trait,
example_value: amount if eneergy expended per time unit

definition: source (provide full name) of expert or citation for definition
preferred standard unit for the trait
free text comment which contains more specific reference and resources based for the trait defined
example_value: check new reference paper, or url for definition of this trait

definition: primary key of the ref_taxonomy entity
complete full scientific name of the taxonomic name
taxonomic id of the reference taxonomy. The taxonomy_id is then generic as the new attribute tax_db will contain ott db type. (ott = open tree of life)
taxonomic db full name
taxonomic db url mapping to the taxonomic name
taxonomy reference db version
parent id of taxonomic name if exists
complete name of the parent of the scientific name
taxonomic level type of the scientific name
phylum of the scientific taxonomic name
class level of the scientific taxonomic name
order level of the scientific taxonomic name
family level of the scientific taxonomic name
genus level of the scientific taxonomic name
species level name
common names used for the species
any specific comments on the taxonomy naming
example_value: manually parsed the names from url

definition: reference key to the ref_taxonomy entity table
reference key to the population entity table
ISO date used for taxonomic labelling
reference label given to the taxa db
version of the taxonomic mapping
primary key of the site entity
name of site
indicates where species inhabit
specific details of the habitat
elevation value of the position where the population has being observed
standard unit of elevation value
depth value where the organism is being observed
standard unit of the depth value
reference key to the Population table
reference key to the Site table
the exact initial date of population collection following the YYYYMMDD format
the exact initial date of population collection following the YYYYMMDD format
initial year when the population is being collected
final year when the population was collected
some contextual free-text based on the point that the population is collected
example_value: Minutes of the longitude (long_mm) after asking for feedback to the submitting author

definition: defined term, Indicates the source where individuals were collected
primary key of the place entity
a place name of a location. For now there is no specification of what to provide for place_name. There is no controlled way yet to define this
relevant notes about the location, mostly free text based based on the curator to keep track of the place where the individuals/population have been observed
reference to know how the place name is provided. For now we provide two options {comment-based, gps-based} in which the location name/term is obtained from the spatial component if provided,
the country where the place is located
geographical collection of countries known as main continent
the geonames id reference that maps to the place name (ideally should be required to be provided in url)
reference key to the Site entity table
reference key to the Place entity table
latitude value in decimal degrees, where individuals were collected. Sign according to Hemisphere where the study was conducted: South is negative and North is positive.
longitude value of the position of the site, in decimal degrees
relevant notes about the location
check if the term used for location maps back to the reference term obtained from the dataset (mapping to location_name)
primary key of respiratory_chamber entity
sensor type used to measure the oxygen during the experiment
volume of the empty respirometric chamber
provide wait (delay) time excluded from closed measurement cycles. Also referred as equilibration period.
material of respirometer, such as plastic or glass
time spend in the respirometry chamber
type of respirometry as defined by the researcher in the paper
breathing mode based on the respiratory medium used in the experiment
type of respirometry type as defined by the researcher in the paper
reference key to measurement relation
reference key to respiratory_chamber entity
ISO date to specifiy when a specific acclimation chamber setup was conducted
primary key of acclimation entity
Indicates whether mating was allowed or not during the acclimation period
provide acclimation time after transfer to respirometry chamber
provide duration of animal fasting before placement in respirometry chamber
fasting standard time unit used
reference key to measurement table
reference to acclimation_specification table
ISO date to specifiy when a specific acclimation condition is observed and conducted
primary key of condition table
temperature value of the condition
photoperiod schedule of daylight and night hours
humidity level measured during the condition
oxygen level measured during the condition
carbon dioxide level measured during the condition
salinity level
pH value of the condition
units used to express the oxygen during the condition
units used to express the oxygen during the condition
food type or description of the food used during the testing
duration period in days of the condition
number of generations during condition
db specific metadata to check what type of condition label we are referring to. This is to double check the origin of the experimental_setup type
reference key to measurement table
reference key to condition table
type of experimental condition. For now there is for {test, maintenance, acclimation} condition
ISO date to specifiy when a specific acclimation chamber setup was conducted
Indicates where the experiment to determine the fecundity was carried out
